text: Henry Barry Hyde (31 May 1854 – 12 April 1932) was an Anglican Archdeacon in India in the early 20th century. Elwes was educated at the Royal Institution School in Liverpool; King's College, London; and University College, Durham. After a curacy in Ashford, Kent he was Private Secretary to Joseph Lightfoot, Bishop of Durham. In 1887 he went out with the Bengal Ecclesiastical Department to India.'The Indian Biographical Dictionary' Hayavadana Rao, C p196: Pillar & Co, Madras, 1915 In 1899 he transferred to Madras, where he was Archdeacon from 1904 to 1910.Crockford's Clerical Directory 1929/30 pp 662/3: London, OUP, 1929 ==References== Category:19th-century Anglican priests Category:20th-century Anglican priests Category:Alumni of University College, Durham Category:Archdeacons of Madras Category:People educated at the Royal Institution School Category:1854 births Category:1932 deaths Category:Alumni of King's College London Category:Fellows of the University of Madras
title: Henry Hyde (priest)
